TTOSOM

Class TTOSOM

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.Classifier
      • TTOSOM.TTOSOM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, weka.core.CapabilitiesHandler, weka.core.OptionHandler, weka.core.RevisionHandler

    public class TTOSOM
extends weka.classifiers.Classifier
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the implementation of the TTOSOM following the specification given in:

    Changes in version 1.0.1 (17, March 2014)

    1. Fixed a bug in the computation of the bubble of activity.
    2. Added modules for the pre-computation of the bubble of activity which speed-up the algorithm dramatically.
    3. Improved javadoc documentation.
    4. Change interface getNeurons() for getWeights() which returns an array of weights.
    5. All the files containing topology information where moved to the folder "data".
    6. Added a series of modules written in R for the visualization of the TTOSOM.
    7. change the internal implementation of FindBMU(...) so as to perform iterative search instead of recursion.

    See Also:

      • findBMU

        public Neuron findBMU(Neuron currentNode,
             weka.core.Instance inputSample,
             Neuron bestSoFar)
        Finds the BMU to a given data sample of the data set
        Parameters:
        currentNode - current node being examined
        inputSample - input sample to calculate the BMU
        bestSoFar - Current best neuron so far.
        distance - distance to calculate the BMU
        dataSet - data set containing the input sample
        Returns:
        best matching unit corresponding to the input sample

      • generateClusterVector

        public int[] generateClusterVector(weka.core.Instances data,
                          Distance distance)
        This method generates a cluster vector. This vector represents the ID of the BMU of a given instance in position i.
        Parameters:
        data - data to generate the cluster vector.
        distance - distance which will be used to find the BMU.
        Returns:
        cluster vector.
